info.description:
Contents
  Overview
  1. iFrame Integration
  2. Booking Widget Integration
  3. Page Redirect Integration
  4. API Integration

Overview
The evolution of the Internet, according to Wikipedia, has occurred in distinct phases, each with increased capacity and capability, now enabling fully fledged applications to exploit its power. Rich Internet applications having all the features and functionality of traditional client-server programs can process the user interface on web browsers and perform mission critical functions and large scale data management on application servers. By being everywhere, the Internet allows clients and servers located anywhere to interact, without constraint, offering immense business and technical advantages.

Cloud computing is a service whereby shared hardware, software, and data are provided as a utility (like electricity) over the Internet. These resources are provided without cloud users needing to own or even know about the computing infrastructure. Cloud software is accessed via web browsers, mobile devices, web servers and other computers. Application developers strive for better service and performance than if their programs were to be installed on end-user computers. IBM has kindly sponsored the excellent booklet Cloud for Dummies for those new to the subject!

However this has come at a significant cost to many small to medium sized businesses because it can lead to a winner takes all result in which a few large players gain dominant market share and then dictate their terms to that market. This is very true of the accommodation marketplace where a few very large web sites are extremely powerful. Indeed hotel chains, airlines and car rental groups have been severely damaged in recent years by this dominance. If global chains can suffer in this way, what chance does the small business have?

BookingPal, Inc. has the solution with its platform â€“ a rich, highly scalable, set of web services which provide immediate access to thousands of travel agents, tour operators, film production companies and hundreds of travel related web portals. Its products enable property managers and owners to store information in the secure computing cloud to be distributed automatically via these channels. For the channel owner there are many different ways in which to access this information using any modern web technology.

BookingPal, Inc. is a transactional platform to enable suppliers (property managers and owners) to interact in near real time with consumers (agents and guests). It uses concepts developed and proven in enterprise applications over many years to enable this interaction.

1. iFrame Integration
If you would like to iFrame our search page as part of your web site then please follow the following steps to initialize and launch the iFrame.



To place an iFrame inside of your HTML page, copy and paste the HTML code where you want to place the iFrame.

  <iframe src="URL" width="1000px" height="1100px"></iframe>

  URL = https://www.mybookingpal.com/search?size=600&pos={pos} to replace the URL.

The parameters are described as follows:

pos This is the ID that was assigned to you when you signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid, you will not get credited for any bookings that occur during that search.

Ensure the iFrame is functioning correctly. You may adjust the width and the height of the iFrame container to fit your needs. If you encounter any problems with the functionality of the search page, please contact us at support@mybookingpal.com. Make sure the pos ID you entered into the iFrame script matches the pos ID we assigned to you during sign up.

2. Booking Widget Integration
If you have built your own search page and are looking for a way to book a property, you can use our booking widget to book a selected property. This is used when visitors wish to book a property on a channel partner's website. You will not need to integrate the reservation REST call if using this widget.

Include the following script into a web page:

  <script src="http://www.mybookingpal.com/js/widget.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

  <script>
   Mybookingpal.setParams({
    pos: '102ee0377e41d5dc',
    currency: 'USD'
   )};
  </script>

Request Parameters:

posThis is the ID that was assigned to you when you signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid, you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.
currencyCurrency in which you would like to see the prices displayed. We use the ISO 4217 standard. Please follow this standard when passing in currency codes. We will only accept these codes and if we cannot determine the correct currency code we will default to USD.

To load the widget, use the following line of code:

  Mybookingpal.showQuote(product_id, date_state, date_end);

Example:

  <a href ="javascript:void(0);" onclick="Mybookingpal.showQuote(2884, '2014-02-28', '2014-02-31');">Test pop-up</a>

3. Page Redirect Integration
BookingPal allows for the re-direction of traffic from a partner website to one of our pages. This section details the pages that are available for re-direction and the parameters that are required for those pages.

Use the following url for re-directing to BookingPal's property details page:

  https://www.mybookingpal.com/search/?logo={logo}&pos={pos}&checkin={checkin}&period={period}&currency={currency}
  &adults={adults}&product_id={product_id}#/product

Request Parameters:

logoThis is the URL to an image to replace BookingPal's logo in the page. If not provided, defaults to BookingPal logo.
posThe pos code that was assigned to you when you signed up with BookingPal. Make sure you are using the right pos code or else you will not be credited for any bookings generated by you.
checkinThe check-in date. Should be in the format yyyy-MM-dd
periodThe length of stay
currencyCurrency to show prices. We use ISO 4217 currency codes
adultsThe number of adults who will be staying at the property
product_idBookingPal's unique identifier for the prodct being redirected to.


4. API Integration
BookingPal allows channel partners to interact with our API through various REST calls, which will allow you to receive all information you need to display on your webpage. If you are unclear about how REST calls work or need more information, this site provides thorough information on the topic: http://rest.elkstein.org/2008/02/what-is-rest.html

The following sections will give you details on how to build a search page, get property details and book a property online. These API calls will be important when formulating detailed property pages, and connecting search and booking capabilities from your system(s) to BookingPal's. It is important to note that all parameters are case sensitive in this document and should be used as documented.

BookingPal has a test environment (demo.mybookingpal.com) that can be utilized to develop code against. There are a limited number of properties in this environment but should be sufficient for code development. Our support team can setup a demo account. Prior to going to production, our integration team must approve your development and insure that it meets our requirement for production. Please call our integration team to help you move from test to production.

get.description: Use this function to gind a location and get a valid ID.  This function does not require the complete name it will return a list of names that come close to the string submitted. The response may have several names and IDs.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Name of location

get.description: This function will match an exact string and will return back a single ID

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Name of location

get.summary: Get location related to channel partner
get.description: Returns only location that relates to current channel parter.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Name of location

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Channel partner POS identifier

get.description: When building your page to display property details it is important to note that we make a call to the property owner to confirm pricing and dates. Because of this the API call may take longer to return depending on the property. To build a property details page we have provided three API calls to build out a complete property details page. It will be up to the designer of the property details page to determine what information should be included in the page.

parameters.name: productid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the property obtained from the search page, if an invalid ID is passed an error will be returned

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: The date of check out, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency in which you would like to see the prices displayed. We use the ISO 4217 . Please follow this standard when passing in currency codes. We will only accept these codes and if we cannot determine the correct currency code we will default to USD.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date of begin cancellation calendar search start

get.description: This function will return a list of properties that can be used to build a search page. This API call should not be used to build a local cache. If you wish to build a local cache you will need to request an XML file from BookingPal.

parameters.name: locationid
parameters.description: ID of location in which we will search

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: The date of check in, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: The date of check out, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: guests
parameters.description: Number of guests

parameters.name: amenity
parameters.description: Param for output into response product amenities codes. Can be either true or false.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency in which you would like to see the prices displayed. We use the ISO 4217 . Please follow this standard when passing in currency codes. We will only accept these codes and if we cannot determine the correct currency code we will default to USD.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page

parameters.name: perpage
parameters.description: Number of products per page

parameters.name: exact_match
parameters.description: If set to true, will only return properties that exactly match search criteria

parameters.name: commission
parameters.description: If set to true, will return the commission for each property

parameters.name: display_inquire_only
parameters.description: Will return inquiry only properties if set to true, otherwise will include bookable and inquiry only properties

get.description: This API call will return price information for the specified product.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: productid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the property obtained from the search page, if an invalid ID is passed an error will be returned

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: The date of check in, the date format should follow yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: The date of check out, the date format should follow yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency in which you would like to see the prices displayed. We use the ISO 4217 . Please follow this standard when passing in currency codes. We will only accept these codes and if we cannot determine the correct currency code we will default to USD.

parameters.name: adults
parameters.description: Number of adults (default 2)

parameters.name: chld
parameters.description: Number of children (default 0)

get.description: This function will return the availability calendar of the selected property.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: productid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the property obtained from the search page, if an invalid ID is passed an error will be returned

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: The date of checkin, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: The date of check out. The date should be after the fromdate and the format should follow YYYY-mm-dd.

get.description: For properties that can be booked online (paymentSupported=true) credit card information is required. For properties that cannot be booked online (paymentSupported=false) the credit information is not required. It is important to note that some of these properties we may have to make an API call to the property providers system to confirm the transaction. Because of this, the response to the call may take more time. The amount of time for the call to return will depend on the property provider and their systems response times.For properties that have paymentSupported=false the credit card information is not required just the renter information is required. Emails will be sent to both the renter and Property manager and BookingPal will assume that the property has been booked and reserved for the renter.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: productid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the property obtained from the search page, if an invalid id is passed an error will be returned

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: The date of check in, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: The date of check out, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency in which amount is being submitted with this request. We use the ISO 4217 standard to identify the currency. Please follow this standard when passing in currency codes. We will only accept these codes and if we cannot determine the correct currency code we will default to USD.

parameters.name: emailaddress
parameters.description: Email address of customer

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description: First name of customer

parameters.name: familyname
parameters.description: Family name of customer

parameters.name: cardnumber
parameters.description: Credit card number, required if bookable online. No spaces or dashes

parameters.name: cardmonth
parameters.description: Month of card expiration, required if bookable online using the following format mm

parameters.name: cardyear
parameters.description: Year of card expiration, required if bookable online, format yyyy

parameters.name: cardtype
parameters.description: Required if bookable online

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: First payment amount

parameters.name: telnumber
parameters.description: Phone number

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: Any notes that need to be sent to the property manager

parameters.name: adult
parameters.description: Number of adults

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: Number of children

parameters.name: cc_security_code
parameters.description: Credit card security code, required if bookable online

parameters.name: cc_address
parameters.description: Address of credit card, required if bookable online

parameters.name: cc_country
parameters.description: Country of credit card, required if bookable online

parameters.name: cc_state
parameters.description: State or region of credit card, required if bookable online

parameters.name: cc_city
parameters.description: City of credit card, required if bookable online

parameters.name: cc_zip
parameters.description: Zip/Postal code of credit card, required if bookable online

parameters.name: cc_bdd
parameters.description: Credit card hold birthdate day. Required if bookable online. Formatted as dd.

parameters.name: cc_bdm
parameters.description: Credit card holder birthdate month. Required if bookable online. Formatted as mm.

parameters.name: cc_bdy
parameters.description: Credit card holder birthdate year. Required if bookable online. Formatted as yyyy.

post.description: Use this call to book the property through POST. You are able to send the request body in both JSON and XML format, and receive either JSON or XML as a response, depending on what you send through the REST call.

parameters.name: reservation
parameters.description: Reservation body. See GET version of this call for the descriptions of the parameters.

get.description: Use this API function to make an inquiry request for a specific property. Only properties that are tagged as inquiry can be booked this way. If an inquiry request is made, the inquiry will be treated as a transaction in the BookingPal platform.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: productid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the property obtained from the search page, if an invalid ID is passed an error will be returned

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: The date of check in, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: The date of check out, the date format should follow YYYY-mm-dd

parameters.name: emailaddress
parameters.description: Email address of customer

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description: First name of customer

parameters.name: familyname
parameters.description: Family name of customer

parameters.name: telnumber
parameters.description: Phone number

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: Any notes that need to be sent to the property manager

parameters.name: adult
parameters.description: Number of adults that plan on staying

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: Number of children that plan on staying

get.description: This API function will return a list of products. Use this function if you want to return a list of product IDs and their names.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Accommodation

get.description: This function will return average weekly prices for the selected property.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: This is the ID that was assigned to you when signed up with BookingPal. If the ID is not valid you will not get credited for any bookings that occur for that search.

parameters.name: productid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the property obtained from the search page. If it is an invalid ID, an error will be returned.

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: Start period of availability calendar search

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: End period of availability calendar search

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency in which you would like to see the prices displayed. We use the ISO 4217. Please follow this standard when passing in currency codes. We will only accept these codes and if we cannot determine the correct currency code we will default to USD.
